when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！(arigatou,tetsudattekurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used to say farewell.
example: さようなら、また会いましょう。(sayounara,mata aimashou) - Goodbye, let's meet again.

when_to_say: Used to greet someone in the morning.
example: おはよう、元気？(ohayou,genki?) - Good morning, how are you?

when_to_say: Used when apologizing or when trying to get someone's attention.
example: すみません、道に迷いました。(sumimasen,michi ni mayoimashita) - Excuse me, I got lost.

when_to_say: Used to affirm or agree.
example: はい、それで大丈夫です。(hai, sore de daijoubu desu) - Yes, that's fine.

when_to_say: Used to decline or disagree.
example: いいえ、それは違います。(iie,sore wa chigaimasu) - No, that's incorrect.

word: ありがとうごさいます
when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in formal situations.
example: 本当にありがとうございました。(hontou ni arigatou gozaimashita) - Thank you very much.

when_to_say: Used when making a request.
example: これをおねがいします。(kore wo onegai shimasu) - Please, this one.

when_to_say: Used in response to 'thank you'.
example: どういたしまして、また何でも言ってください。(dou itashimashite, mata nandemo itte kudasai) - You're welcome, feel free to ask anytime.

when_to_say: Used to express amazement or admiration.
example: この景色はすごい！(kono keshiki wa sugoi!) - This view is amazing!

when_to_say: Used to express understanding.
example: わかりました、ありがとうございます。(wakarimashita, arigatou gozaimasu) - I understand, thank you.

when_to_say: Used to express that something is not allowed or not good.
example: それはだめです。(sore wa dame desu) - That is not allowed.

when_to_say: Used to ask how someone is.
example: お元気ですか？(ogenki desu ka?) - How are you?

word: よろしくおねがいします
meaning: Please take care of it / Nice to meet you
when_to_say: Used when asking for a favor or at the beginning of a new relationship.
example: こちらこそよろしくおねがいします。(kochira koso yoroshiku onegaishimasu) - It's nice to meet you, too.

when_to_say: Used to describe something beautiful or clean.
example: この花はきれいです。(kono hana wa kirei desu) - This flower is beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to confirm that everything is okay or to ask if something is okay.
example: 大丈夫ですか？(daijoubu desu ka?) - Are you okay?

when_to_say: Used to refer to the day before today.
example: 昨日は楽しかったです。(kinou wa tanoshikatta desu) - Yesterday was fun.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the present time.
example: 今、何をしていますか？(ima, nani wo shiteimasu ka?) - What are you doing now?

when_to_say: Used when referring to eating.
example: 昼ごはんを食べます。(hirugohan wo tabemasu) - I will eat lunch.

when_to_say: Used when referring to seeing or looking.
example: 映画を見るのが好きです。(eiga wo miru no ga suki desu) - I like watching movies.

when_to_say: Used to describe something new.
example: 新しい車を買いました。(atarashii kuruma wo kaimashita) - I bought a new car.

when_to_say: Used to describe something old.
example: この本は古いです。(kono hon wa furui desu) - This book is old.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a friend.
example: 私の友達は日本人です。(watashi no tomodachi wa nihonjin desu) - My friend is Japanese.

when_to_say: Used to refer to one's home.
example: 家に帰ります。(ie ni kaerimasu) - I will go home.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a car.
example: 車を運転します。(kuruma wo untenshimasu) - I drive a car.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a train.
example: 電車で行きます。(densha de ikimasu) - I go by train.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a school.
example: 私は学校に行きます。(watashi wa gakkou ni ikimasu) - I go to school.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a teacher.
example: 先生に質問します。(sensei ni shitsumon shimasu) - I will ask the teacher a question.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a book.
example: 本を読みます。(hon wo yomimasu) - I read a book.

when_to_say: Used to refer to food.
example: 食べ物が美味しいです。(tabemono ga oishii desu) - The food is delicious.

when_to_say: Used to refer to drinks.
example: 飲み物をください。(nomimono wo kudasai) - Please give me a drink.

when_to_say: Used when referring to running.
example: 毎朝公園で走ります。(mai asa kouen de hashirimasu) - I run in the park every morning.

when_to_say: Used when referring to swimming.
example: 海で泳ぐのが好きです。(umi de oyogu no ga suki desu) - I like swimming in the sea.

when_to_say: Used when referring to walking.
example: 毎日公園を歩きます。(mainichi kouen wo arukimasu) - I walk in the park every day.

when_to_say: Used when referring to speaking or talking.
example: 日本語を話します。(nihongo wo hanashimasu) - I speak Japanese.

when_to_say: Used when asking a question or listening to something.
example: 質問を聞いてもいいですか？(shitsumon wo kiite mo ii desu ka?) - Can I ask a question?

when_to_say: Used when referring to showing something.
example: その写真を見せてください。(sono shashin wo misete kudasai) - Please show me that picture.

when_to_say: Used when referring to buying something.
example: 本を買います。(hon wo kaimasu) - I will buy a book.

when_to_say: Used when referring to selling something.
example: 店で商品を売っています。(mise de shouhin wo utteimasu) - I am selling products at the store.

when_to_say: Used when referring to waiting.
example: バスを待っています。(basu wo matteimasu) - I am waiting for the bus.

when_to_say: Used when referring to meeting people.
example: 友達に会います。(tomodachi ni aimasu) - I meet my friend.

when_to_say: Used when referring to walking.
example: 公園を歩きます。(kouen wo arukimasu) - I walk in the park.

when_to_say: Used when referring to eating.
example: 昼ごはんを食べます。(hirugohan wo tabemasu) - I eat lunch.

when_to_say: Used when referring to drinking.
example: ジュースを飲みます。(juusu wo nomimasu) - I drink juice.

when_to_say: Used when referring to sleeping.
example: 私は毎晩寝ます。(watashi wa maiban nemasu) - I sleep every night.

when_to_say: Used when referring to waking up.
example: 毎朝6時に起きます。(mai asa 6-ji ni okimasu) - I wake up at 6 AM every morning.

when_to_say: Used when referring to seeing.
example: テレビを見ます。(terebi wo mimasu) - I watch TV.

when_to_say: Used when referring to asking or listening.
example: 先生に質問を聞きます。(sensei ni shitsumon wo kikimasu) - I ask the teacher a question.

when_to_say: Used when referring to making something.
example: 料理を作ります。(ryouri wo tsukurimasu) - I make food.

when_to_say: Used when referring to coming to a place.
example: 友達が家に来ます。(tomodachi ga ie ni kimasu) - My friend is coming to my house.

when_to_say: Used when referring to going to a place.
example: 学校に行きます。(gakkou ni ikimasu) - I go to school.

when_to_say: Used when referring to leaving or exiting a place.
example: 家を出ます。(ie wo demasu) - I leave the house.

when_to_say: Used when referring to entering a place.
example: 部屋に入ります。(heya ni hairimasu) - I enter the room.

when_to_say: Used when referring to using something.
example: パソコンを使います。(pasokon wo tsukaimasu) - I use a computer.

when_to_say: Used when referring to buying something.
example: 本を買います。(hon wo kaimasu) - I buy a book.

when_to_say: Used when referring to selling something.
example: 店で商品を売ります。(mise de shouhin wo urimasu) - I sell products at the store.

when_to_say: Used when referring to creating or making something.
example: アートを作ります。(aato wo tsukurimasu) - I create art.

when_to_say: Used when referring to cleaning.
example: 部屋を掃除します。(heya wo souji shimasu) - I clean the room.

when_to_say: Used when referring to studying.
example: 日本語を勉強します。(nihongo wo benkyou shimasu) - I study Japanese.

when_to_say: Used when referring to running.
example: 公園で走ります。(kouen de hashirimasu) - I run in the park.

when_to_say: Used when referring to reading something.
example: 本を読みます。(hon wo yomimasu) - I read a book.

when_to_say: Used when referring to writing something.
example: 手紙を書きます。(tegami wo kakimasu) - I write a letter.

when_to_say: Used when referring to singing.
example: カラオケで歌います。(karaoke de utaimasu) - I sing at karaoke.

when_to_say: Used when referring to swimming.
example: 海で泳ぎます。(umi de oyogimasu) - I swim in the sea.

when_to_say: Used when referring to working.
example: 私は会社で働きます。(watashi wa kaisha de hatarakimasu) - I work at a company.

meaning: to rest, to take a break
when_to_say: Used when referring to resting or taking a break.
example: 今日は休みです。(kyou wa yasumi desu) - Today is a rest day.

when_to_say: Used when referring to borrowing something.
example: 本を借りる。(hon wo kariru) - I borrow a book.

when_to_say: Used when referring to lending something.
example: 友達にお金を貸す。(tomodachi ni okane wo kasu) - I lend money to a friend.

when_to_say: Used when referring to waiting for something.
example: バスを待ちます。(basu wo machimasu) - I wait for the bus.

when_to_say: Used when referring to starting something.
example: 新しい仕事を始めます。(atarashii shigoto wo hajimemasu) - I start a new job.

when_to_say: Used when referring to flying.
example: 鳥が空を飛んでいます。(tori ga sora wo tondeimasu) - The bird is flying in the sky.

when_to_say: Used when referring to reading.
example: 本を読みます。(hon wo yomimasu) - I read a book.

when_to_say: Used when referring to writing.
example: 手紙を出します。(tegami wo dashimasu) - I send a letter.

when_to_say: Used when referring to seeing.
example: テレビを見るのが好きです。(terebi wo miru no ga suki desu) - I like watching TV.

when_to_say: Used when referring to listening.
example: 音楽を聞きます。(ongaku wo kikimasu) - I listen to music.

when_to_say: Used when referring to talking.
example: 日本語を話します。(nihongo wo hanashimasu) - I speak Japanese.

when_to_say: Used when referring to playing.
example: 子供たちは公園で遊んでいます。(kodomotachi wa kouen de asondeimasu) - The children are playing in the park.

when_to_say: Used when referring to sleeping.
example: 私は毎晩10時に寝ます。(watashi wa maiban 10-ji ni nemasu) - I sleep at 10 PM every night.

when_to_say: Used when referring to waking up.
example: 毎朝6時に起きます。(mai asa 6-ji ni okimasu) - I wake up at 6 AM every morning.

when_to_say: Used when referring to cleaning.
example: 部屋を掃除します。(heya wo souji shimasu) - I clean the room.

when_to_say: Used when referring to cooking.
example: 母は料理が得意です。(haha wa ryouri ga tokui desu) - My mother is good at cooking.

when_to_say: Used when referring to lunch.
example: 昼ごはんを食べます。(hirugohan wo tabemasu) - I eat lunch.

when_to_say: Used when referring to dinner.
example: 夕ごはんは7時です。(yuugohan wa 7-ji desu) - Dinner is at 7 PM.

when_to_say: Used when referring to breakfast.
example: 私は毎朝朝ごはんを食べます。(watashi wa maiasa asagohan wo tabemasu) - I eat breakfast every morning.

when_to_say: Used when referring to movies.
example: 映画を見るのが好きです。(eiga wo miru no ga suki desu) - I like watching movies.

when_to_say: Used when referring to music.
example: 音楽を聴くのが好きです。(ongaku wo kiku no ga suki desu) - I like listening to music.

when_to_say: Used when referring to travel.
example: 旅行が大好きです。(ryokou ga daisuki desu) - I love traveling.

when_to_say: Used when referring to shopping.
example: 買い物に行きます。(kaimono ni ikimasu) - I am going shopping.

when_to_say: Used when referring to sports.
example: 私はスポーツをよくします。(watashi wa supootsu wo yoku shimasu) - I often play sports.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a match or game.
example: サッカーの試合があります。(sakkaa no shiai ga arimasu) - There is a soccer match.

when_to_say: Used when referring to weather.
example: 今日は天気がいいです。(kyou wa tenki ga ii desu) - The weather is good today.

when_to_say: Used when referring to hot weather.
example: 今日は暑いです。(kyou wa atsui desu) - It is hot today.

when_to_say: Used when referring to cold weather.
example: 今日は寒いです。(kyou wa samui desu) - It is cold today.

when_to_say: Used when referring to rain.
example: 今日は雨です。(kyou wa ame desu) - It is rainy today.

when_to_say: Used when referring to clear weather.
example: 今日は晴れです。(kyou wa hare desu) - It is clear weather today.

when_to_say: Used when referring to humidity in the weather.
example: 今日は湿度が高いです。(kyou wa shitsudo ga takai desu) - The humidity is high today.

when_to_say: Used when referring to the wind.
example: 今日は風が強いです。(kyou wa kaze ga tsuyoi desu) - The wind is strong today.

when_to_say: Used when referring to snow.
example: 今日は雪が降っています。(kyou wa yuki ga futteimasu) - It is snowing today.

when_to_say: Used when referring to thunder.
example: 雷が鳴っています。(kaminari ga natteimasu) - Thunder is roaring.

when_to_say: Used when referring to weather forecasting.
example: 天気予報を見ます。(tenki yohou wo mimasu) - I watch the weather forecast.

meaning: to clear up, to become sunny
when_to_say: Used when referring to clearing up weather.
example: 明日は晴れるでしょう。(ashita wa hareru deshou) - Tomorrow will likely be sunny.

when_to_say: Used when referring to rain falling.
example: 明日は雨が降ります。(ashita wa ame ga furimasu) - It will rain tomorrow.

when_to_say: Used when referring to wind blowing.
example: 風が強く吹いています。(kaze ga tsuyoku fuiteimasu) - The wind is blowing strongly.

when_to_say: Used when referring to snow falling.
example: 今日は雪が降ります。(kyou wa yuki ga furimasu) - It will snow today.

when_to_say: Used when referring to hot weather or temperature.
example: 今日は暑いです。(kyou wa atsui desu) - It is hot today.

when_to_say: Used when referring to cold weather or temperature.
example: 今日は寒いです。(kyou wa samui desu) - It is cold today.

when_to_say: Used when referring to heat, usually in a figurative sense.
example: 夏の暑さが苦手です。(natsu no atsusa ga nigate desu) - I don't like the heat of summer.

when_to_say: Used when referring to coldness, usually in a figurative sense.
example: 冬の寒さに耐えられません。(fuyu no samusa ni taeraremasen) - I cannot endure the coldness of winter.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a thunderstorm.
example: 雷雨が予報されています。(raiu ga yohou sareteimasu) - A thunderstorm is forecasted.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a typhoon.
example: 台風が近づいています。(taifuu ga chikadzuiteimasu) - A typhoon is approaching.

when_to_say: Used when describing something challenging.
example: この問題は難しいです。(Kono mondai wa muzukashii desu.) - This problem is difficult.

when_to_say: Used when talking about taking on a difficult task.
example: 新しい挑戦をします。(Atarashii chousen o shimasu.) - I will take on a new challenge.

when_to_say: Used when referring to putting in hard work.
example: 成功は努力次第です。(Seikou wa doryoku shidai desu.) - Success depends on effort.

when_to_say: Used when enduring something difficult.
example: 痛みを我慢します。(Itami o gaman shimasu.) - I endure the pain.

when_to_say: Used when overcoming challenges or obstacles.
example: 困難を克服しました。(Konnan o kokufuku shimashita.) - I overcame the difficulties.

when_to_say: Used to encourage or describe determination.
example: 最後まで頑張ります。(Saigo made ganbarimasu.) - I will persevere until the end.

when_to_say: Used to describe a situation full of challenges.
example: 人生には困難がある。(Jinsei ni wa konnan ga aru.) - Life has hardships.

when_to_say: Used to describe an unsuccessful attempt.
example: 失敗から学びます。(Shippai kara manabimasu.) - Learn from failure.

when_to_say: Used to describe determination in difficult situations.
example: 覚悟を決めて挑みます。(Kakugo o kimete idomimasu.) - I will face it with resolve.

when_to_say: Used to describe bravery in the face of adversity.
example: 彼の勇気に感動しました。(Kare no yuuki ni kandou shimashita.) - I was moved by his courage.

when_to_say: Used to describe enduring hardship or pain.
example: 痛みに耐えます。(Itami ni taemasu.) - Endure the pain.

when_to_say: Used to describe a tough trial or test.
example: 試練を乗り越えます。(Shiren o norikoemasu.) - Overcome the ordeal.

when_to_say: Used to describe intense or spiritual training.
example: 修行に励みます。(Shugyou ni hagemimasu.) - I devote myself to training.

when_to_say: Used to describe experiencing failure.
example: 挫折から立ち上がります。(Zasetsu kara tachiagarimasu.) - I rise from setbacks.

when_to_say: Used to describe a state of hopelessness.
example: 絶望に打ち勝ちます。(Zetsubou ni uchikachimasu.) - I overcome despair.

when_to_say: Used to describe someone who doesn’t give up.
example: 粘り強い態度が大切です。(Nebaridzuyoi taido ga taisetsu desu.) - Tenacity is important.

when_to_say: Used when referring to giving up something for a cause.
example: 犠牲が必要です。(Gisei ga hitsuyou desu.) - Sacrifice is necessary.

when_to_say: Used when trying something challenging.
example: 新しい方法を試みます。(Atarashii houhou o kokoromimasu.) - I will attempt a new method.
